discussion.content:
Transport Service Package => OTV
Advanced Service Package => VDC
MPLS Service Package => MPLS, VPN, VPLS, ACI
Enterprise Service Package => Routing protocols, GRE, VXLAN, etc.
Enhanced Layer 2 Package => FabricPath, Intelligent CAM, etc.

Correct answer: A,E. 
OTV requires Transport Services. Enterprise Services for supporting protocols (IS-IS, PIM, etc.) Advanced Services is only for VDC contexts -- you can run OTV without that. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/nx-os/licensing/guide/b_Cisco_NX-OS_Licensing_Guide/b_Cisco_NX-OS_Licensing_Guide_chapter_01.html

questions.question_text: Which two licenses must you have to enable OTV on a Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switch? (Choose two.)
Which two options decrease when using a Cisco Unified Fabric Topology as compared to an isolated fabric topology? (Choose two.)

choices.C: the cost-per-port of the Fibre Channel switches
choices.E: the number of uplinks required on the Fibre Channel director switches
choices.A: the number of cables required to connect to the pod
choices.D: the power consumption of each pod

discussion.content: i think it's AE, FC dissappears.

questions.question_text: Which two platforms support the FCoE protocol? (Choose two.)
Which two options are common switching protocols that are used in the data center? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I believe that the dumped Ethernet option should be corrected into STP.

comments.content: but STP is not a switching (L2) protocol, it is just a way to prevent loops/broadcasting storms

questions.question_text: You deploy new server infrastructure by using a Cisco UCS platform. Which two design options can you use to increase the redundancy of the new compute solution? (Choose two.)

choices.B: a pin vNIC in the server profile to a specific Fabric Interconnect node that has failover disabled
choices.C: an uplink port in a port channel configuration
choices.E: more than one server port to connect the Cisco UCS B-Series blade IOM
choices.D: static pinning at the server ports
